moves.1. e4 c5: I enjoy playing Najdorf and Dragon and so started with Sicilian
moves.2. Bc4 d6: I had never seen this and expected 3.Qf3 and so just played a normal Sicilian move 2... d6
moves.3. Bxf7+: This had me at a lost why would someone sacrifice their Bishop so early and I saw no future threats that couldn't be dealt with easily
moves.3... Kxf7 4. Qh5+ g6 5. Qd5+ Ke8: Not 5...Be6 6. Qxb7 Nd7 losing me a pawn
moves.6. Nf3 Nf6 7. Qc4 Nc6 8. Ng5: Wanting to play 9.Nf7 winning a rook the rook on h8
moves.8... Ne5: A good move attacking and defending at the same time
moves.9... Bh6 10. Nf3:
Not 10.f4 attacking the e5 knight and defending the pawn
However 10... Bxg5 11.fxg5 Nxe4 wins a pawn
But with 12. d3 forces the e4 knight in Zugzwang
This was a interesting move as it allowed me to attack his Queen again
moves.18... Nf4 19. Qd4 Nxg2+ 20. Kf2 Bh3: I was willing to trade queens because I was up a minor piece
moves.22... Nf4 23. Bxf4 Bxf4: I decide to free up the bishop by trying to trade Night for Bishop He kindly accepts
moves.24. Ne2 Bxe5 25. d4 Bxd4+: Trying to push home my material advantage
moves.26. Nxd4 Rxd4 27. Rad1 Rxd1 28. Rxd1: He continues to accept my exchanges
moves.30. b3 Bf5 31. c4 Bd7 32. h4 h5 33. Rd4: I look to attack his a-b pawn island
moves.36. f4 Rf5 37. Rb7 Ra5 38. a4 Bd1: He gladly allows me to attack his pawn island because of 37. Rb7 and 38. a4
moves.39. f5 gxf5: I realise I can win by taking the a and b pawns and then trading rooks so I take his f-pawn
moves.41. Rb5 Rxb5 42. axb5: He allows me to move free my a-pawn by attacking his two b pawns
moves.42... Be2 43. Kxf5 Bxb5 44. Kg5: Wants to free his own h pawn
moves.44... Be2 45. b4 Kd7: Time to get the king involved
moves.46. b5 Bxb5 47. Kxh5: Now I can win easily by checking him and forcing him to move his h-pawn into my bishops path
moves.47... Be2+ 48. Kg5 a5 49. h5: He resigns here because of next combo
moves.49... Bxh5 50. Kxh5 a4: Now I have my a-pawn free to queen and my unmoved e-pawn able to queen if I need it
